data.title: Move Texture2D::GetImage and TextureCube::GetImage implementations.
data.body: I needed Texture2D::GetImage for last months and today I've found out that Urho already has such function in AS binding. So I've moved it to C++ class and updated Lua pkgs. I've also added some error messages and simplified some Lua bindings around Detach.

data.title: i686-pc-mingw32: Undefined reference to RegisterDeviceNotificationW
data.body:
## Problem

I realise the wiki says to use w64 instead of pc, but I was able to get this one to work regardless and it might be an issue that also occurs when compiling 64 bit (I wasn't able to build a 64 bit compiler so I can't say for sure).

```
../ThirdParty/SDL/libSDL.a(SDL_windowsjoystick.c.obj):SDL_windowsjoystick.c:(.text+0x1c2): undefined reference to `RegisterDeviceNotificationW'
```

Further up, this message occurs:

```
/home/thecomet/documents/programming/cpp/Urho3D/Source/ThirdParty/SDL/src/joystick/windows/SDL_windowsjoystick.c: In function ‚ÄòSDL_CreateDeviceNotification‚Äô:
/home/thecomet/documents/programming/cpp/Urho3D/Source/ThirdParty/SDL/src/joystick/windows/SDL_windowsjoystick.c:187:5: warning: implicit declaration of function ‚ÄòRegisterDeviceNotificationW‚Äô [-Wimplicit-function-declaration]
     data->hNotify = RegisterDeviceNotification(data->messageWindow, &dbh, DEVICE_NOTIFY_WINDOW_HANDLE);
     ^
```

According to this: http://www.mingw.org/category/wiki/how_to
_You need to set defines _WIN32_WINDOWS, _WIN32_WINNT, WINVER and/or _WIN32_IE to the minimum platform you plan to support before including the windows.h header file._
## Solution

In the file `Source/ThirdParty/SDL/src/joystick/windows/SDL_windowsjoystick.c` on line 48:

```
#define WINVER 0x0500      // This fixed the problem
#include "../../core/windows/SDL_windows.h
```

data.title: (feature request) Antialiazed wireframes
data.body:
I notoced, that bgfx draws wireframes with enabled anitialiasing BGFX_STATE_LINEAA and it looks nice

In opengl it requires `glEnable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);` and `graphics->SetBlendMode(BLEND_ALPHA);`
so I pace this line in DebugRenderer::Render() before rendering lines

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13021826/19014599/e21a67be-87f9-11e6-8e1e-42795b43a555.png)

(space grid still render without BLEND_ALPHA and looks fat)

data.title: Decalset memory leak
data.body:
Hello, it seem that decals set have some memory problems.

I have made a terrain decal system so i am creating one decalset per terrain patch (to handle decals at patch border correctly) the system is working fine and the decals are correctly positioned and rendered. 

When i am traveling over the terrain with my free camera i can see the decals and everything is fine but after a few seconds (there is no exact time) the memory start to grow up more and more quite fast. Here is my observations: 
- When the camera do not move the memory consumption is **not** growing up 
- When the camera distance to decalset is above the decalset draw distance and if the camera is moving  the memory consumption is **not** growing up 
- The memory is only growing up when the camera is moving and when the decals are rendered
- It seem that DecalSet::UpdateBuffers() is called regularly, don't know if it is a normal behaviour or not.
- I have tried to set a null drawrange, of course i have 3 frames per seconds but the memory consumption is crazy (like 6Gb instead of 800mb when i use a drawrange of 256.0 on decals sets)
- I have tested to fly with the camera over some StaticModelGroups (my vegetation system) and there no such memory consumption problem. Memory consumption is very stable.

Tested under Windows / DX11.

data.title: setShaderParameter Variant overload doesn't handle double case.
data.body:
In my code I had something like

```
something.shaderParameters_["SomeValue"] = 1.4;
```

which didn't work but changing it to

```
something.shaderParameters_["SomeValue"] = 1.4f;
```

worked (note the f at the end). Upon investigation [SetShaderParameter](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/Graphics/OpenGL/OGLGraphics.cpp#L1344) does not have a case for when the parameter is a double so it's ignored. 

I like more to remove float support in the variant class and always use double. This way it's simpler. The choice of how you fix this is yours, I'm just giving my opinion from an API users perspective. 

Thank you & great library üëç

data.title: How to draw lines in Urho3D's UI Window
Decal rendering issue
data.body:
Hello i try to use this technique 

```
<technique vs="PBRLitSolid" ps="PBRLitSolid" vsdefines="IBL" psdefines="DIFFMAP PBR IBL">
    <pass name="alpha" depthwrite="false" blend="alpha" />
    <pass name="litalpha" depthwrite="false" blend="addalpha" />
</technique>
```

on a decal and here is the results: 

http://imgur.com/GxeVGX2

As you can see, it is wrongly lit by the point light. Do you know what is the source of this problem ? missing tangent informations ? (DX11, desktop, deferred rendering)

I can use the same technique on a normal mesh without any issue.

Thanks !

data.title: Multisample textures
data.body:
This implements ability for Texture2D and TextureCube rendertargets to be multisampled. On OpenGL / Direct3D11 Texture2D can operate with or without automatic resolve to 1-sample; when operating without, a shader can instead access the individual samples. Also adds multisample option for VSM shadows, which makes them smoother but costs some performance.

Multisampling is not (at least currently) supported on OpenGL ES.

data.title: Custom android-cmake toolchain
data.body:
Hi with the latest relases of Android studio there is an up to date android-cmake toolchain which includes clang and other options like using libc++ instead of stl_port which is a lot more complete.
if anyone is interested I can add the toolchain to a repo. The problem is when I try to use it with Urho3D's CMake I am getting errors. These are the flags that I am using:

```
$(dirname $0)/cmake_generic.sh "$@" \
    -DANDROID=1 \
    -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=$ANDTOOLCHAIN \
    -DANDROID_NDK=$ANDROID_NDK \
    -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release \
    -DANDROID_ABI="armeabi-v7a" \
    -DANDROID_TOOLCHAIN=clang \
    -DANDROID_STL=c++_static \
    -DANDROID_NATIVE_API_LEVEL=android-19
```

These are the errors I am getting

```
error: unknown target CPU 'armv7-a'
CMake Error at CMake/Modules/Urho3D-CMake-common.cmake:970 (message):
  The configured compiler toolchain in the build tree is not able to handle
  all the compiler flags required to build the project with PCH enabled.
  Please kindly update your compiler toolchain to its latest version.  If you
  are using MinGW then make sure it is MinGW-W64 instead of MinGW-W32 or
  TDM-GCC (Code::Blocks default).  Or disable the PCH build support by
  passing the '-DURHO3D_PCH=0' when retrying to configure/generate the build
  tree.  However, if you think there is something wrong with our build system
  then kindly file a bug report to the project devs.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMake/Modules/Urho3D-CMake-common.cmake:1024 (enable_pch)
  CMake/Modules/Urho3D-CMake-common.cmake:1108 (setup_target)
  Source/Urho3D/CMakeLists.txt:284 (setup_library)
```

data.title: Alpha to coverage is breaking whole alpha blending
data.body:
Alpha to coverage is breaking the whole alpha blending process. See by yourself.

Tested on desktop, DX11 and deferred renderpath. (alphatocoverage is not enabled anywhere in material or pass as it is useless with deferred rendering).

This is the bug: 

http://imgur.com/dnZuMwW

And when i change the line 2454 in D3D11Graphics.cpp to stateDesc.AlphaToCoverageEnable = false;

the problem is solved as you can see: 

http://imgur.com/Pj8IjWd

data.title: Sample crash when changing MaterialQuality engine parameter.
Shader cache location
data.body:
Shader cache is written to a fixed location('<Application Directory>/Data/Shaders/HLSL/Cache') now.
When an application is installed to the Program Files this location is not writable and the cache is not working.
I propose to add the ability to specify the shader cache location.

data.title: Cast from U to int in EnumAttributeAccessorImpl::Get
data.body:
EnumAttributeAccessorImpl::Set picks int from Variant and casts it to actual enum type.
If EnumAttributeAccessorImpl::Get would do the same, can it have some unexpected side effects?
I sure no, but I want to confirm.

I want to make this change to allow EnumAttributeAccessorImpl support enum classes that are not implicitly convertible to integer types.

data.title: GLSL compilation issue on NVIDIA Shield
data.body:
On an NVIDIA Shield, I am receiving this GLSL compilation error:

```
[Urho3D] Failed to compile pixel shader LitSolid(AMBIENT DIFFMAP DIRLIGHT PERPIXEL SHADOW SIMPLE_SHADOW SPECULAR):
[Urho3D] (1123) : error C1115: unable to find compatible overloaded function "GetShadow(vec4[1], mediump float)"
[Urho3D] Compiled vertex shader LitSolid(DIRLIGHT NORMALMAP PERPIXEL SHADOW SKINNED)
[Urho3D] Failed to compile pixel shader LitSolid(AMBIENT DIFFMAP DIRLIGHT NORMALMAP PERPIXEL SHADOW SIMPLE_SHADOW SPECULAR):
[Urho3D] (1124) : error C1115: unable to find compatible overloaded function "GetShadow(vec4[1], mediump float)"
```

Changing to `highp` here, does fix the error and render properly on device: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/bin/CoreData/Shaders/GLSL/Uniforms.glsl#L52

I also tested on an iPad4, and that worked without any changes or errors, any thoughts?  I did try specifying mediump/highp on the GetShadow function declaration, to no avail

data.title: Per-instance material parameters
data.body:
Idea is simple: I suggest to allow setting up material parameters from object instance, because current system forces user to have different material for each _instance_ of prefab if he wants to set different material settings.

It could be some extra optional parameter in batch structures that is used as source of uniforms. I'ven't investigated this deeply, but it doesn't look super-complicated.
Such parameters could be passed into batches from some new attribute in drawables.

data.title: Can SetModel and SetMaterial be virtual?
data.body:
Subject.
I've found that it could be useful for writing my own Drawable's.
If I confirm this, can I make'em virtual?
It shouldn't affect performance because Urho already has tons of virtual calls.

data.title: Expose mouse position manipulation api in Input class
data.body:
`Input::SetMousePosition()` and `Input::CenterMousePosition()` are moved to public access scope to allow access to these APIs. Sometimes there is need to manually position cursor and there are no other means.

One of such usecases is  having cursor hover UI button when application is opened should button be positioned right in center of the screen. This is more of a problem on mobile platforms where cursor is not visible and it is not clear why one (hovered) button looks differently than the others.
